channel.title: cache on CDS - Continuous Delivery Service
channel.description: Recent content in cache on CDS - Continuous Delivery Service

item.title: pull
item.description: worker cache pull worker cache pull tagValue Synopsis Inside a project, you can fetch a cache from your worker with a tag worker pull <tagValue> If you push a cache with: worker cache push latest {{.cds.workspace}}/pathToUpload The command: worker cache pull latest will create the directory {{.cds.workspace}}/pathToUpload with the content of the cache If you want to push a cache into a storage integration: worker cache push latest --from=MyStorageIntegration {{.

item.title: push
item.description: worker cache push worker cache push tagValue {{.cds.workspace}}/pathToUpload Synopsis Inside a project, you can create a cache from your worker with a tag (useful for vendors for example) worker push dir/file You can use you storage integration: worker push –destination=MyStorageIntegration dir/file worker cache push [flags] Examples worker cache push {{.cds.workflow}}-{{.cds.version}} {{.cds.workspace}}/pathToUpload Options --destination string optional. Your storage integration name -h, --help help for push SEE ALSO worker cache -
